edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.local

Class LayeredGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.local.LayeredGraph

  • public class LayeredGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    The class LayeredGraph is used as a basis for Galant implementations of a variety of crossing minimization algorithms. It provides several functionalities:
    1. Methods that translate layers and positions within layers into y-coordinates and x-coordinates, respectively. These coordinates are scaled with respect to the window dimensions: layers are evenly spaced with padding at the top and bottom equal to the interlayer distance. The same scaling principle is applied to each layer.
    2. Methods that supply infrastructure for crossing minimization algorithms such as numberOfCrossings, assignWeights and sortByWeight (for barycenter and related heuristics).
    3. Methods that separate logical attributes from display attributes. For example, dynamic versions of sifting and barycenter (logically) mark nodes/layers to indicate that they will not be chosen again during the current pass; at various points in the animation it is desirable to display the logical marks in some way; methods such as mark(), unMark(), and displayMarks() accomplish this functionality.
    4. Methods that facilitate the highlighting of groups of nodes and edges in the specific context of (layered) crossing minimization algorithms; these include highlight() -- with arguments speficifying a layer and the direction of the edges to be highlighted, unhighlight(),
    It is assumed that all edges are directed from nodes on layer i to ones on layer i+1 for some i. Also assumed is that node id's range from 0 to n-1, where n is the number of nodes, and edge id's are in the range 0 to m-1, where m is the number of edges.

      These constants are used to determine both highlighting and assignment of weights to nodes on a layer.

      • assignWeights

        public void assignWeights(int layer,
                          LayeredGraph.Scope scope)
        Assigns logical weights to nodes on the given layer based on average position of adjacent nodes on neighboring layer(s).
        Parameters:
        scope - If this is UP, sorting is based on the higher numbered layer, if it's DOWN it's based on the lower numbered layer, if it's BOTH it will be the average of the two.

      • sortByWeight

        public void sortByWeight(int layer)
        Sorts nodes on the given layer by their logical weights.

      • highlight

        public void highlight(int i,
                      LayeredGraph.Scope scope)
               throws Terminate
        Highlights nodes on layer i.
        Parameters:
        scope - determines which incident edges, if any, should be highlighted: if scope is UP, the edges pointing to the higher-numbered layers are highlighted; if DOWN, those to the lower-numbered layer; if both, all incident edges; if LAYER, the nodes only.
        Throws:
        Terminate

      • unHighlight

        public void unHighlight(int i)
                 throws Terminate
        Undoes any highlighting of nodes on layer i and their incident edges.
        Throws:
        Terminate

      • unHighlight

        public void unHighlight()
                 throws Terminate
        Undoes highlighting for all nodes and edges.
        Throws:
        Terminate

      • highlightNodes

        public void highlightNodes(int layer,
                           int positionOne,
                           int positionTwo)
                    throws Terminate
        Highlights the nodes between the two given positions, inclusive; used, for example, to highlight an insertion.
        Throws:
        Terminate

      • numberOfCrossings

        public int numberOfCrossings()
        Returns:
        total number of crossings based on current logical positions.

      • getCrossings

        public int getCrossings(Edge e)
        Returns:
        the number of edges that cross edge e, based on current logical positions.

      • getCrossings

        public int getCrossings(Node leftNode,
                        Node rightNode)
        Returns:
        the number of crossings that arise among the edges incident to and y if x is to the left of y. Assumes that both are on the same layer.

      • crossingsBetweenLayers

        public int crossingsBetweenLayers(int layer)
        Returns:
        number of crossings among edges between layer and layer + 1. Uses O(|E|+|C|) algorithm from "Simple and efficient bilayer cross counting," W. Barth, M. Juenger, P. Mutzel, in JGAA, 2004.

      • getMaxCrossingsLayer

        public int getMaxCrossingsLayer()
        Returns:
        the index of the (logically) unmarked layer with the maximum number of crossings or -1 if all layers are marked.

      • getMaxEdgeCrossings

        public int getMaxEdgeCrossings()
        Returns:
        the maximum, over all edges e of the graph, of the number of edges crossing e

      • getMaxCrossingsEdge

        public Edge getMaxCrossingsEdge()
        Returns:
        the edge with the most crossings among those that still have one (logically) unmarked endpoint or null if all edges have both endpoints marked.

      • getMaxCrossingsEdge

        public Edge getMaxCrossingsEdge(boolean roundRobin)
        Parameters:
        roundRobin - if true, start the search one index beyond that of the last edge returned by this method
        Returns:
        unmarked edge with the most crossings, as with getMaxCrossingsEdge().

      • sortByIncreasingDegree

        public static void sortByIncreasingDegree(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Sorts nodes by their degree (for use in sifting).

      • sortLayersByIncreasingDegree

        public void sortLayersByIncreasingDegree()
        Sorts nodes on each layer by increasing degree -- for use in middleDegreeSort() and its reversed version

      • middleDegreeSort

        public void middleDegreeSort(boolean largestInMiddle)
        On each layer: puts nodes with largest (smallest) degree in the middle and puts subsequent nodes farther toward the outside.
        Parameters:
        largestInMiddle - if true then the node with largest degree goes in the middle.

      • bottleneckSwap

        public int bottleneckSwap(Node left_node,
                          Node right_node)
        Swaps nodes x and y and updates the edge crossings for their incident edges (the only ones that should be affected). Assumes that x and y are on the same layer and that x is initially to the left of y. Used by the maximum crossings edge heuristic reported by Stallmann in JEA (2012).
        Returns:
        the number of crossings for the edge that has the most crossings after the swap (among those involved in the swap).

      • setEdgeWeights

        public void setEdgeWeights()
                    throws Terminate
        Sets the weight of each edge to be the number of crossings. Used for the slow version of the maximum crossings edge heuristic, as reported by Stallmann (JEA, 2012)
        Throws:
        Terminate
